segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4

segments.pli: 10. Asuravagga
segments.en: 10. Demons

segments.pli: 100. Potaliyasutta
segments.en: 100. With Potaliya the Wanderer

segments.pli: Atha kho potaliyo paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then the wanderer Potaliya went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho potaliyaṃ paribbājakaṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side, and the Buddha said to him:

segments.pli: “Cattārome, potaliya, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Potaliya, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Idha, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: One person criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and substantively. But they don’t praise those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Idha pana, potaliya, ekacco puggalo vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: Another person praises those deserving of praise … But they don’t criticize those deserving of criticism …

segments.pli: Idha pana, potaliya, ekacco puggalo neva avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: Another person doesn’t praise those deserving of praise … Nor do they criticize those deserving of criticism …

segments.pli: Idha pana, potaliya, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
segments.en: Another person criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and substantively. And they praise those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: Ime kho, potaliya, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, potaliya, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ katamo te puggalo khamati abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro cā”ti?
segments.en: Of these four people, who do you believe to be the finest?”

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bho gotama, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Katame cattāro?
Idha, bho gotama, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
Idha pana, bho gotama, ekacco puggalo vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca kho avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
Idha pana, bho gotama, ekacco puggalo neva avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
Idha pana, bho gotama, ekacco puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena.
Ime kho, bho gotama, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Imesaṃ, bho gotama, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo neva avaṇṇārahassa avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, no ca vaṇṇārahassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena;
segments.en: “Master Gotama, of these four people, it is the person who neither praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and substantively; nor criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
segments.en: That is the person I believe to be the finest.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Abhikkantā hesā, bho gotama, yadidaṃ upekkhā”ti.
segments.en: Because, Master Gotama, equanimity is the best.”

segments.pli: “Cattārome, potaliya, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Katame cattāro … pe … ime kho, potaliya, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Imesaṃ kho, potaliya, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā hoti bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena;
segments.en: “Potaliya, of these four people, it is the person who criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and substantively; and praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: ayaṃ imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
segments.en: That is the person I consider to be the finest.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Abhikkantā hesā, potaliya, yadidaṃ tattha tattha kālaññutā”ti.
segments.en: Because, Potaliya, understanding of time and context is the best.”

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bho gotama, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Katame cattāro … pe … ime kho, bho gotama, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
Imesaṃ, bho gotama, catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ yvāyaṃ puggalo avaṇṇārahassa ca avaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena, vaṇṇārahassa ca vaṇṇaṃ bhāsitā bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ kālena;
segments.en: “Master Gotama, of these four people, it is the person who criticizes those deserving of criticism at the right time, truthfully and substantively; and praises those deserving of praise at the right time, truthfully and substantively.

segments.pli: ayaṃ me puggalo khamati imesaṃ catunnaṃ puggalānaṃ abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
segments.en: That is the person I believe to be the finest.

segments.pli: Taṃ kissa hetu?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: Abhikkantā hesā, bho gotama, yadidaṃ tattha tattha kālaññutā.
segments.en: Because, Master Gotama, understanding of time and context is the best.

segments.pli: Abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṃ, bho gotama.
segments.en: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṃ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṃ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṃ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṃ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
segments.en: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Master Gotama has made the teaching clear in many ways.

segments.pli: Esāhaṃ bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ saraṇaṃ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
segments.en: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

segments.pli: Upāsakaṃ maṃ bhavaṃ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Asuravaggo pañcamo.
Asuro tayo samādhī,
chavālātena pañcamaṃ;
Rāgo nisanti attahitaṃ,
sikkhā potaliyena cāti.
Dutiyo paṇṇāsako samatto.

sections.title: Then the wanderer Potaliya went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: Which is better: appropriate praise and criticism, or equanimity?
